grounding: Big data is changing every corner of economics and finance. The largest firms in the US economy are valued chiefly for their data. Yet, these data are largely excluded from macroeconomic and finance research. We review work and relevant tools for measuring economic activity, market power, data markets, and the role of data in financial markets. We also highlight areas where future work is needed.
generated_text: This study explores the transformative impact of big data on the data economy, focusing on the dynamics of data markets and the emerging data feedback loop. It examines the challenges and opportunities in data valuation, particularly in the context of financial data. By analyzing current trends and practices, the research aims to provide insights into optimizing data utilization and fostering sustainable growth in data-driven markets.
